using deepzoom you can load 100MB hubble images no problem
Picasso would probably shit a break
Ion.with(imageview).deepzoom().load(“someurl”);
that’s it
cool
that’ may be wrong I get mixed up when you dont do with(context)
but close enough
ion has a few situational builders that are more or less difficult depending on what you need to do

However, those are extremely large images
<@U055GGAHS>:  since you strongly support ion. is there anything in ion better than Retrofit than image lib
extremely large in respect to mobile
well its completely different approaches
there isn’t a way to really draw that kind of comparison
If I load the exact same image twice into different imageviews, is it safe to assume whatever call to Ion will be 2nd just gets a cached image, or is there a different approach to go?
i like ion as I dont need super rigid approaches to APIs
<@U0542GLTE>: does need a rigid approach to APIs because of his product and being on a large team demands it
<@U04TK850N>: both with Picasso and Ion it will be cached
correct but with a catch
caching does not occur until  load is complete so you may be in a situation where it grabs concurrently because it doesn’t know if it is the same thing
There are a couple of differences, as far as Ion and RetroFit goes, Ion uses Futures where RetroFit supports Rx java.
ok thx
Ion supports Canceling where you would have to build a OKHtttp call in order to do that with RetroFit
but still you used Retrofit?
and ion cancelling is per request or per group
*use
Ion has websockets, RetroFit doesn't
I use RetroFit because we have a very structured API. I don't manually parse anything but 1 call, and thats because it's XML from AWS
And the three calls I need to cancel are built in a SearchClass that wraps OkHttp
So it's not really that big of a deal. I just pass it the search param.
got it.
But, that saves me a lot of coding in comparison to Ion, and we use a lot of RxJava here, so that obviously helps too
Not saying you couldn't support Rx with Ion, but RetroFit supports it natively
right so its more of a what do you need
if you need something quick that works, ion is awesome
if you have a big complex project, you might want to think more heavily about what you need to accomplish
my app has several Apis
mostly lots of data
back and forth
and lots of images

Bookings data

hotels , restaurants, pois etc
